name.text: 10.3.7 (Use area interpretation to find definite integral)

questiontext.text:
The graph of \(y=f(x)\) is shown below.

[[jsxgraph width='400px' height='200px']] JXG.Options.axis.ticks.majorHeight = 20; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.insertTicks = false; JXG.Options.axis.ticks.ticksDistance = 100; JXG.Options.text.fontSize = 16; var brd = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, {axis:true, grid: true, boundingbox:[-0.5,4.5,6.5,-0.8], showCopyright: false, showNavigation:false}); var allsegs = brd.create('curve',[{#[0,ax,bx,cx]#},{#[0,yval,yval,0]#}],{strokeWidth:3,strokeColor:'#003399'}); var xaxis = brd.create('axis', [[0,0],[1,0]]); brd.create('ticks', [xaxis, [2,4,6]], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [0, -10],anchorX: 'middle', anchorY: 'top' }}); var yaxis = brd.create('axis', [[0,0],[0,1]]); brd.create('ticks', [yaxis, [2,4,6]], {strokeColor: '#003399', majorHeight:15, drawLabels: true, label: { offset: [-10, 0],anchorX: 'right', anchorY: 'middle' }}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Use the area interpretation of the definite integral to evaluate the following:

\(\displaystyle {@q1@}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

\(\displaystyle {@q2@}=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
(a) This is simply the area of a triangle, with base {#ax#} and height {#yval#}. So the area is \(\frac12\times{@ax@}\times{@yval@}={@ta1@}\).

(b) This area is made up of two pieces:

  • The first (\({@ax@}\leq x\leq{@bx@}\)) is a rectangle with base {#bx-ax#} and height {#yval#}.
  • The second (\({@bx@}\leq x\leq{@cx@}\)) is a triangle with base {#cx-bx#} and height {#yval#}.
So overall the area is \({@(bx-ax)*yval@}+{@(cx-bx)*yval/2@}={@ta2@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
